purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to external domains via HTTP requests.
flows: network interfaces -> macAddresses -> base64 encoded string
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains that appear to be from oast.fun and byted-dast.com
Sending system information to external domains without user consent
Use of rejectUnauthorized: false in HTTP request configuration
Data exfiltration via GET requests to third-party domains
analysis: This code collects sensitive system information such as MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then attempts to send this data to known command and control (C2) servers using HTTP GET requests. The presence of hardcoded domain names associated with security testing services (oast.fun, byted-dast.com) combined with the data exfiltration pattern strongly suggests this code is designed for data theft or remote access purposes.
conclusion: This is malicious code that steals system information and sends it to external servers, indicating potential malware behavior.
